page.title: 01GENERAL PREVIEW OF THE AREA.
page.content: Forest is the major land use of this area.It occupies a ridge of high ground (117m) between the valleys of the R.Lea and R.Roding.GEOLOGY:Patches of pebble gravel at High Beech deposited in pre-glacial times resting on London Clay,acid soils poorly drained. TRANSPORT:Londons Orbital M25 opened Jan.85,its building and subsequent use has had a big impact on tranquility of area.Busy A121(E-W)and A11(T)(N-S) cross area,congestion at rush hours. HOUSING:Expensive individual properties contrast-modern private estates and old country houses along secluded lanes.Now area designated Greenbelt development restricted.PEOPLE:Consists mainly of people who have lived in area a long time,many elderly and retired.New rich moving into area aquiring expensive property-close commuting to London.
